questions.question: What caused the stock market crash of 1929

choices.answer: prices rose and investors purchased more stock
People quickly sold their stocks before prices fell further
farmers could not produce enough food for the USA
World War I caused the economy to fall

questions.question: What was President Roosevelt's plan for getting the United States out of the Great Depression?

choices.answer: The New Deal
Te Relief, Recovery,Reform Act
The Alphabet Agencies
FDR's Deal
The people did not farm the land enough
Not enough people lived in that area
A drought along with too much farming
Too much rain caused flooding

questions.question: When people went to the banks to get out their savings-

choices.answer: The banks loaned them more money
The banks had loaned the money so they couldn't give it back
Banks had borrowed money from businesses to pay the people
The government paid people to cover the money banks had lost

questions.question: Which president was blamed for causing the Great Depression

choices.answer: President Roosevelt
President Hoover
President Bush
President Coolidge

questions.question: Which of the following was a result of the Civilian Conservation Corps?

choices.answer: Money placed in the banks would be insured up to $2,500.00
Artists produced art for public buildings
Labor unions were guaranteed the right to organize
Young men were paid to build parks and plant trees

questions.question: What were groups of homes built out of cardboard, tin, or scrap wood called?

choices.answer: Hoovervilles
Roosevelt Villages
Shack Towns
Coolidgevilles

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a cause of the Great Depression?

choices.answer: People bought stocks on credit or borrowed money
Banks had to close because they did not have enough money
Many businesses had a surplus of goods that couldn't be sold
The New Deal tried to start too many new programs

questions.question: The purpose of Social Security was to

choices.answer: Provide monthly income for the elderly and  disabled
Set the lowest amount of money that workers could be paid
Built dams on the Tennessee River
Give jobs to young men

questions.question: Why did farmers leave the Dust Bowl states during the 1930s?

choices.answer: To try farming in the North
To join the bonus Army in Washington D.C.
Because the New Deal gave everyone a job in the factories
Because they were unable to farm the land anymore

questions.question: What best describes a way in which the Great Depression affected the lives of Americans?

choices.answer: Many people moved from shantytowns to the suburbs.
Many children quit school to help their families earn money.
More people got married immediately after finishing school.
Farmers and businessmen were hurt by the rising crop prices

questions.question: In what ways did the New Deal help Americans?

choices.answer: It improved education for all citizens
It helped people pay taxes
It provided jobs, food, and shelter for those in need
It protected people from discrimination

questions.question: Why did Americans elect Franklin D. Roosevelt as the new president in 1932?

choices.answer: He promised that we would not be involved in any more wars
He promised Americans that they would not lose their jobs
He promised to create programs to improve the economy
He promised the government wouldn't interfere in the economy

questions.question: How did life change for women in the 1920s?

choices.answer: Women gained the right to vote
Women gained more equality
Women began to work outside the home
All of the above

questions.question: One form of music that became popular in the 1920s was

choices.answer: Country and Western
Jazz
Rock and Roll
Rap

questions.question: Which New Deal program restored confidence in the banking system and prevented bank panics?

choices.answer: CCC
FDIC
SSA
SEC

questions.question: What happened in the United States as a result of Prohibition?

choices.answer: Many people in rural areas moved to urban cities
Crop prices increased
Women gained the right to vote
Bootleggers and speakeasies became popular

questions.question: Henry Ford found that he could produce cars less expensively by:

choices.answer: Using plastic instead of steel for cars
Hiring only immigrants to work his factory
Using designs make in China
Using a moving assembly line
